docs.text: BudgetPlan ¶ BudgetPlan is a Python package to plan your future budget, playing around interactively using what-if scenarios.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: BudgetPlan is a Python package to plan your future budget, playing around interactively using what-if scenarios.
docs.title: BudgetPlan

docs.text: Assets ¶ This class can be used to create (nested) AssetList objects Parameters: Name Type Description Default name the name of the AssetList object required data a list containing Asset and/or AssetList objects required agg ( self , f_agg , r_init = None ) ¶ This method iterates over an (nested) AssetList and return an aggregated result using the aggregation function f_agg Parameters: Name Type Description Default f_agg aggregation function able to handle 2 arguments r: intermediate aggregation result, o: object to be added to the aggregation required r_init initial value to which aggregation result will be added. The aggregation function f_agg should be able to handle this type as the intial value. None Source code in budgetplan/assets.py def agg ( self , f_agg , r_init = None ): """ This method iterates over an (nested) AssetList and return an aggregated result using the aggregation function `f_agg` Arguments: f_agg: aggregation function able to handle 2 arguments r: intermediate aggregation result, o: object to be added to the aggregation r_init: initial value to which aggregation result will be added. The aggregation function `f_agg` should be able to handle this type as the intial value. """ r = r_init for i , o in enumerate ( self . data ): if isinstance ( o , Asset ): r = f_agg ( r , o ) elif isinstance ( o , AssetList ): r = o . agg ( f_agg , r ) return r from_yaml ( loader , node ) classmethod ¶ This method instantiates an AssetList object from a yaml file Source code in budgetplan/assets.py @classmethod def from_yaml ( cls , loader , node ): """ This method instantiates an AssetList object from a yaml file """ value = loader . construct_mapping ( node ) return AssetList ( value [ "name" ], value [ "data" ]) to_yaml ( dumper , mapping ) classmethod ¶ This method defines the yaml representation of an assetlist Source code in budgetplan/assets.py @classmethod def to_yaml ( cls , dumper , mapping ): """ This method defines the yaml representation of an assetlist """ return dumper . represent_mapping ( cls . yaml_tag , { "name" : mapping . name , "data" : mapping . data } )

docs.text: This class can be used to create (nested) AssetList objects Parameters: Name Type Description Default name the name of the AssetList object required data a list containing Asset and/or AssetList objects required
docs.title: Assets

docs.text: This method iterates over an (nested) AssetList and return an aggregated result using the aggregation function f_agg Parameters: Name Type Description Default f_agg aggregation function able to handle 2 arguments r: intermediate aggregation result, o: object to be added to the aggregation required r_init initial value to which aggregation result will be added. The aggregation function f_agg should be able to handle this type as the intial value. None Source code in budgetplan/assets.py def agg ( self , f_agg , r_init = None ): """ This method iterates over an (nested) AssetList and return an aggregated result using the aggregation function `f_agg` Arguments: f_agg: aggregation function able to handle 2 arguments r: intermediate aggregation result, o: object to be added to the aggregation r_init: initial value to which aggregation result will be added. The aggregation function `f_agg` should be able to handle this type as the intial value. """ r = r_init for i , o in enumerate ( self . data ): if isinstance ( o , Asset ): r = f_agg ( r , o ) elif isinstance ( o , AssetList ): r = o . agg ( f_agg , r ) return r
docs.title: agg()

docs.text: This method instantiates an AssetList object from a yaml file Source code in budgetplan/assets.py @classmethod def from_yaml ( cls , loader , node ): """ This method instantiates an AssetList object from a yaml file """ value = loader . construct_mapping ( node ) return AssetList ( value [ "name" ], value [ "data" ])
docs.title: from_yaml()

docs.text: This method defines the yaml representation of an assetlist Source code in budgetplan/assets.py @classmethod def to_yaml ( cls , dumper , mapping ): """ This method defines the yaml representation of an assetlist """ return dumper . represent_mapping ( cls . yaml_tag , { "name" : mapping . name , "data" : mapping . data } )
